trans-unit.source: What's new in ATA version 1.7 | Microsoft ATA
trans-unit.target: What's new in ATA version 1.7 | Microsoft ATA

trans-unit.source: Lists what was new in ATA version 1.7 along with known issues
trans-unit.target: Lists what was new in ATA version 1.7 along with known issues

trans-unit.source: What's new in ATA version 1.7
trans-unit.target: What's new in ATA version 1.7

trans-unit.source: These release notes provide information about known issues in this version of Advanced Threat Analytics.
trans-unit.target: These release notes provide information about known issues in this version of Advanced Threat Analytics.

trans-unit.source: What's new in the ATA 1.7 update?
trans-unit.target: What's new in the ATA 1.7 update?

trans-unit.source: The update to ATA 1.7 provides improvements in the following areas:
trans-unit.target: The update to ATA 1.7 provides improvements in the following areas:

trans-unit.source: New & updated detections
trans-unit.target: New & updated detections

trans-unit.source: Role-based access control
trans-unit.target: Role-based access control

trans-unit.source: Support for Windows Server 2016 and Windows Server Core
trans-unit.target: Support for Windows Server 2016 and Windows Server Core

trans-unit.source: User experience improvements
trans-unit.target: User experience improvements

trans-unit.source: New & updated detections
trans-unit.target: New & updated detections

trans-unit.source: **Reconnaissance using Directory Services Enumeration** As part of the reconnaissance phase, attackers gather information about the entities in the network using different methods.
trans-unit.target: **Reconnaissance using Directory Services Enumeration** As part of the reconnaissance phase, attackers gather information about the entities in the network using different methods.

trans-unit.source: Directory services enumeration using the SAM-R protocol enables attackers to obtain the list of users and groups in a domain and understand the interaction between the different entities.
trans-unit.target: Directory services enumeration using the SAM-R protocol enables attackers to obtain the list of users and groups in a domain and understand the interaction between the different entities.

trans-unit.source: **Pass-the-Hash Enhancements** To enhance Pass-the-Hash detection, we added additional behavioral models for the authentication patterns of entities.
trans-unit.target: **Pass-the-Hash Enhancements** To enhance Pass-the-Hash detection, we added additional behavioral models for the authentication patterns of entities.

trans-unit.source: These models enable ATA to correlate entity behavior with suspicious NTLM authentications, and differentiate real Pass-the-Hash attacks from the behavior of false positive scenarios.
trans-unit.target: These models enable ATA to correlate entity behavior with suspicious NTLM authentications, and differentiate real Pass-the-Hash attacks from the behavior of false positive scenarios.

trans-unit.source: **Pass-the-Ticket Enhancements** To successfully detect advanced attacks in general and Pass-the-Ticket in particular, the correlation between an IP address and the computer account must be accurate.
trans-unit.target: **Pass-the-Ticket Enhancements** To successfully detect advanced attacks in general and Pass-the-Ticket in particular, the correlation between an IP address and the computer account must be accurate.

trans-unit.source: This is a challenge in environments where IP addresses change rapidly by design (for example Wi-Fi networks and multiple virtual machines sharing the same host).
trans-unit.target: This is a challenge in environments where IP addresses change rapidly by design (for example Wi-Fi networks and multiple virtual machines sharing the same host).

trans-unit.source: To overcome this challenge and improve the accuracy of the Pass-the-Ticket detection, ATA’s Network Name Resolution (NNR) mechanism was improved significantly to reduce false-positives.
trans-unit.target: To overcome this challenge and improve the accuracy of the Pass-the-Ticket detection, ATA’s Network Name Resolution (NNR) mechanism was improved significantly to reduce false-positives.

trans-unit.source: **Abnormal Behavior Enhancements** In ATA 1.7, NTLM authentication data was added as a data source for the abnormal behavior detections, providing the algorithms with broader coverage of entity behavior in the network.
trans-unit.target: **Abnormal Behavior Enhancements** In ATA 1.7, NTLM authentication data was added as a data source for the abnormal behavior detections, providing the algorithms with broader coverage of entity behavior in the network.

trans-unit.source: **Unusual Protocol Implementation Enhancements** ATA now detects unusual protocol implementation in the Kerberos protocol, along with additional anomalies in the NTLM protocol.
trans-unit.target: **Unusual Protocol Implementation Enhancements** ATA now detects unusual protocol implementation in the Kerberos protocol, along with additional anomalies in the NTLM protocol.

trans-unit.source: Specifically, these new anomalies for Kerberos are commonly used in Over-pass-the-Hash attacks.
trans-unit.target: Specifically, these new anomalies for Kerberos are commonly used in Over-pass-the-Hash attacks.

trans-unit.source: Infrastructure
trans-unit.target: Infrastructure

trans-unit.source: **Role based access control** Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) capability.
trans-unit.target: **Role based access control** Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) capability.

trans-unit.source: ATA 1.7 includes three roles: ATA Administrator, ATA Analyst and ATA Executive.
trans-unit.target: ATA 1.7 includes three roles: ATA Administrator, ATA Analyst and ATA Executive.

trans-unit.source: **Support for Windows Server 2016 and Windows Server Core** ATA 1.7 supports the deployment of Lightweight Gateways on domain controllers running Server Core for Windows Server 2012 and Server Core for Windows Server 2012 R2.
trans-unit.target: **Support for Windows Server 2016 and Windows Server Core** ATA 1.7 supports the deployment of Lightweight Gateways on domain controllers running Server Core for Windows Server 2012 and Server Core for Windows Server 2012 R2.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, this release supports Windows Server 2016 both for the ATA Center and ATA Gateway components.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, this release supports Windows Server 2016 both for the ATA Center and ATA Gateway components.

trans-unit.source: User Experience
trans-unit.target: User Experience

trans-unit.source: **Configuration Experience** In this release, the ATA configuration experience was redesigned for a better user experience and to better support of environments with multiple ATA Gateways.
trans-unit.target: **Configuration Experience** In this release, the ATA configuration experience was redesigned for a better user experience and to better support of environments with multiple ATA Gateways.

trans-unit.source: This release also introduces the ATA Gateway update page for simpler, better management of automatic updates for the various Gateways.
trans-unit.target: This release also introduces the ATA Gateway update page for simpler, better management of automatic updates for the various Gateways.

trans-unit.source: Known issues
trans-unit.target: Known issues

trans-unit.source: The following known issues exist in this version.
trans-unit.target: The following known issues exist in this version.

trans-unit.source: Gateway automatic update may fail
trans-unit.target: Gateway automatic update may fail

trans-unit.source: **Symptoms:** In environments with slow WAN links, the ATA Gateway update may reach the timeout for the update (100 seconds) and fail to complete successfully.
trans-unit.target: **Symptoms:** In environments with slow WAN links, the ATA Gateway update may reach the timeout for the update (100 seconds) and fail to complete successfully.

trans-unit.source: In the ATA Console, the ATA Gateway will have the status of "Updating (downloading package)" for a long amount of time and it eventually fails.
trans-unit.target: In the ATA Console, the ATA Gateway will have the status of "Updating (downloading package)" for a long amount of time and it eventually fails.

trans-unit.source: **Workaround:** To work around this issue, download the latest ATA Gateway package from the ATA Console, and update the ATA Gateway manually.
trans-unit.target: **Workaround:** To work around this issue, download the latest ATA Gateway package from the ATA Console, and update the ATA Gateway manually.

trans-unit.source: Migration failure when updating from ATA 1.6
trans-unit.target: Migration failure when updating from ATA 1.6

trans-unit.source: When updating to ATA 1.7, the update process may fail with the following error code *0x80070643*:
trans-unit.target: When updating to ATA 1.7, the update process may fail with the following error code *0x80070643*:

trans-unit.source: Update ATA to 1.7 error
trans-unit.target: Update ATA to 1.7 error

trans-unit.source: Review the deployment log to find the cause of the failure.
trans-unit.target: Review the deployment log to find the cause of the failure.

trans-unit.source: The deployment log is located in the following location, **%temp%\..\Microsoft Advanced Thread Analytics Center_{date_stamp}_MsiPackage.log**.
trans-unit.target: The deployment log is located in the following location, **%temp%\..\Microsoft Advanced Thread Analytics Center_{date_stamp}_MsiPackage.log**.

trans-unit.source: In the table below lists the errors to look for and the corresponding Mongo script to fix the error.
trans-unit.target: In the table below lists the errors to look for and the corresponding Mongo script to fix the error.

trans-unit.source: See example below the table on how to run the Mongo script:
trans-unit.target: See example below the table on how to run the Mongo script:

trans-unit.source: Error in deployment log file
trans-unit.target: Error in deployment log file

trans-unit.source: Mongo script
trans-unit.target: Mongo script

trans-unit.source: System.FormatException: Size {size},is larger than MaxDocumentSize 16777216
trans-unit.target: System.FormatException: Size {size},is larger than MaxDocumentSize 16777216

trans-unit.source: Further down in the file:
trans-unit.target: Further down in the file:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.Tri.Center.Deployment.Package.Actions.DatabaseActions.MigrateUniqueEntityProfiles(Boolean isPartial)
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.Tri.Center.Deployment.Package.Actions.DatabaseActions.MigrateUniqueEntityProfiles(Boolean isPartial)

trans-unit.source: db.UniqueEntityProfile.find().forEach(function(obj){if(Object.bsonsize(obj) > 12582912) {print(obj._id);print(Object.bsonsize(obj));db.UniqueEntityProfile.remove({_id:obj._id});}})
trans-unit.target: db.UniqueEntityProfile.find().forEach(function(obj){if(Object.bsonsize(obj) > 12582912) {print(obj._id);print(Object.bsonsize(obj));db.UniqueEntityProfile.remove({_id:obj._id});}})

trans-unit.source: System.OutOfMemoryException: Exception of type 'System.OutOfMemoryException' was thrown
trans-unit.target: System.OutOfMemoryException: Exception of type 'System.OutOfMemoryException' was thrown

trans-unit.source: Further down in the file:
trans-unit.target: Further down in the file:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.Tri.Center.Deployment.Package.Actions.DatabaseActions.ReduceSuspiciousActivityDetailsRecords(IMongoCollection`1 suspiciousActivityCollection, Int32 deletedDetailRecordMaxCount)
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.Tri.Center.Deployment.Package.Actions.DatabaseActions.ReduceSuspiciousActivityDetailsRecords(IMongoCollection`1 suspiciousActivityCollection, Int32 deletedDetailRecordMaxCount)

trans-unit.source: db.SuspiciousActivity.find().forEach(function(obj){if(Object.bsonsize(obj) > 500000),{print(obj._id);print(Object.bsonsize(obj));db.SuspiciousActivity.remove({_id:obj._id});}})
trans-unit.target: db.SuspiciousActivity.find().forEach(function(obj){if(Object.bsonsize(obj) > 500000),{print(obj._id);print(Object.bsonsize(obj));db.SuspiciousActivity.remove({_id:obj._id});}})

trans-unit.source: System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicException: Bad Length
trans-unit.target: System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicException: Bad Length

trans-unit.source: Further down in the file:
trans-unit.target: Further down in the file:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.Tri.Center.Deployment.Package.Actions.DatabaseActions.MigrateCenterSystemProfile(IMongoCollection`1 systemProfileCollection)
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.Tri.Center.Deployment.Package.Actions.DatabaseActions.MigrateCenterSystemProfile(IMongoCollection`1 systemProfileCollection)

trans-unit.source: CenterThumbprint=db.SystemProfile.find({_t:"CenterSystemProfile"}).toArray()[0].Configuration.SecretManagerConfiguration.CertificateThumbprint;db.SystemProfile.update({_t:"CenterSystemProfile"},{$set:{"Configuration.ManagementClientConfiguration.ServerCertificateThumbprint":CenterThumbprint}})
trans-unit.target: CenterThumbprint=db.SystemProfile.find({_t:"CenterSystemProfile"}).toArray()[0].Configuration.SecretManagerConfiguration.CertificateThumbprint;db.SystemProfile.update({_t:"CenterSystemProfile"},{$set:{"Configuration.ManagementClientConfiguration.ServerCertificateThumbprint":CenterThumbprint}})

trans-unit.source: To run the appropriate script, follow the following steps.
trans-unit.target: To run the appropriate script, follow the following steps.

trans-unit.source: From an elevated command prompt, browse to the following location: **C:\Program Files\Microsoft Advanced Threat Analytics\Center\MongoDB\bin**
trans-unit.target: From an elevated command prompt, browse to the following location: **C:\Program Files\Microsoft Advanced Threat Analytics\Center\MongoDB\bin**

trans-unit.source: Type – **Mongo.exe ATA** (*Note*: ATA must be capitalized.)
trans-unit.target: Type – **Mongo.exe ATA** (*Note*: ATA must be capitalized.)

trans-unit.source: Paste the script that matches the error in the deployment log from the table above.
trans-unit.target: Paste the script that matches the error in the deployment log from the table above.

trans-unit.source: ATA Mongo Script
trans-unit.target: ATA Mongo Script

trans-unit.source: At this point you should be able to restart the upgrade.
trans-unit.target: At this point you should be able to restart the upgrade.

trans-unit.source: ATA reports a large number of “*Reconnaissance using directory services enumerations*” suspicious activities:
trans-unit.target: ATA reports a large number of “*Reconnaissance using directory services enumerations*” suspicious activities:

trans-unit.source: This is most likely happening if there is a network scanning tool running on all (or a lot) of client machines in the organization.
trans-unit.target: This is most likely happening if there is a network scanning tool running on all (or a lot) of client machines in the organization.

trans-unit.source: If you are seeing this problem:
trans-unit.target: If you are seeing this problem:

trans-unit.source: In case you can identify the reason or the specific application that running on the client machines, send an email to ATAEval at Microsoft.com with the information.
trans-unit.target: In case you can identify the reason or the specific application that running on the client machines, send an email to ATAEval at Microsoft.com with the information.

trans-unit.source: Use the following mongo script to dismiss all these events (see above how to execute the mongo script):
trans-unit.target: Use the following mongo script to dismiss all these events (see above how to execute the mongo script):

trans-unit.source: db.SuspiciousActivity.update({_t: "SamrReconnaissanceSuspiciousActivity"}, {$set: {Status: "Dismissed"}}, {multi: true})
trans-unit.target: db.SuspiciousActivity.update({_t: "SamrReconnaissanceSuspiciousActivity"}, {$set: {Status: "Dismissed"}}, {multi: true})

trans-unit.source: ATA sends notifications for dismissed suspicious activities:
trans-unit.target: ATA sends notifications for dismissed suspicious activities:

trans-unit.source: If notifications have been configured, ATA may keep sending notifications (email, syslog and event logs) for dismissed suspicious activities.
trans-unit.target: If notifications have been configured, ATA may keep sending notifications (email, syslog and event logs) for dismissed suspicious activities.

trans-unit.source: There is no workaround for this issue now.
trans-unit.target: There is no workaround for this issue now.

trans-unit.source: ATA Gateway may fail to register with the ATA Center if TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1 are disbaled:
trans-unit.target: ATA Gateway may fail to register with the ATA Center if TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1 are disbaled:

trans-unit.source: If TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1 disabled on the ATA Gateway (or Lightweight Gateway), the gateway may fail to register itself on the ATA Center
trans-unit.target: If TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1 disabled on the ATA Gateway (or Lightweight Gateway), the gateway may fail to register itself on the ATA Center

trans-unit.source: Automatic certificate renewal for the certificates used by ATA is not supported
trans-unit.target: Automatic certificate renewal for the certificates used by ATA is not supported

trans-unit.source: The use of automatic certificate renewal may cause ATA to stop functioning when the certificate is automatically renewed.
trans-unit.target: The use of automatic certificate renewal may cause ATA to stop functioning when the certificate is automatically renewed.
